result.execSummary:
The defendant MARKUS B KOWALKOWSKI was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

Court costs due during first year of probation.
Pay supervision fees.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment
No contact with victims: D.G. or J.K.

supervisions.notes: Fines, costs, and restitution are due during term of supervision.  Dept of Corrections to collect from defendant's wages and from other monies held in the defendant's inmate account, an amount or a percentage which the department determines is reasonable.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Markus B Kowalkowski appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail, in custody.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  M/Work Search/Huber and Release for Medical Issues.  Statements by defendant, indicating no employment at this time, but SEEK visits the jail each week.  Defendant indicates release date is 7/20.  State opposes until defendant is employed.  Defendant indicates SEEK cannot meet with him until he has work release privileges.  Court amends judgment to grant work release for purposes of SEEK meeting with him to locate a job, upon a job, work release granted.  Court denies release for medical issue.  State submits a letter from the victim, requesting modification of the no contact order as a condition of probation.  Statements by victim.  Court orders motion to modify no contact order for DG denied.

conditions:  no contact with J.K. or D.G. or their residence, not to possess any syringes or firearms,   Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

State appears by Attorney Adam Gerol. Defendant in custody appearing by video from Ozaukee County Jail with Attorney Rachel Alme-Boaz as a friend of the court. Defendant wishes to retain private counsel. Counsel waives reading. Court finds probable cause. State requests $500 cash bail with conditions. Counsel requesting status on preliminary hearing; waiving time limits. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the preliminary hearing. Court orders $500 cash bail with conditions:  no contact with J.K. or D.G. or their residence, not to possess any syringes or firearms,   Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.  Status hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:15 am.
